page.title: 12Beacon Hill
page.content: Beacon Hill is 1045ft (319m) high and stands the North side of the road above Richmond. On top is an ancient Beacon which would have been lit to warn people in Richmond Castle of raiders. On a clear day you get a beautiful view of the Dales countryside. Sometimes it is possible to see York Minster During the Spanish Armada a warning signal was received from Roseberry Topping, above Guisborough. The Beacon was then lit to pass the message on to Durham. It was manned again in the 19th century when the Napoleonic invasion was threatend. The last time it was lit was in 1981 when Prince Charles and Lady Diana Spencer got married.
